document_data.name: Proskur
document_data.mainbody: '''Proskur''' ({{Pronounce|PROSS|kurr|refs=}}) was a trading city in [[Cormyr]], that was located south of the kingdom's traditional borders, in the [[Dragon Coast]] region of the [[Eastern Heartlands]]. While it had become a place known for honest and fair trade, and was even a haven for the unscrupulous [[Red Wizards]].

Geography.Flora & fauna: The city lent its name to the [[roouddan]], a vegetable colloquially known as the "red [[turnip]] of Proskur".<ref>{{Cite dungeon/191/Eye on the Realms: Jalander's Dodge|2}}

Government.Law & Order: Thieves and swindlers had a very hard time in Proskur as the Proskur council were all very familiar with their methods.

document_data.Defense: The city was known to maintain both its own military and city guard force.
document_data.Trade:
''Circa'' the mid–14{{th}} century [[DR]], a variety of exotic and useful items and substances could be found among the merchants of Proskur. The heart, eyes, and brains of [[catoblepas]] were imported from the [[Farsea Marshes]] to be sold in Proskur. Around that same time, a small merchant company in the city dispatched trade caravans leaded up with [[maxoris]], a preservative used as an alternative to salt and [[spices]].

Proskur was one of the stops along the trade route of the [[Thousandheads Trading Coster]].
document_data.History:
Since its founding, Proskur was an independent trade city with a historical associated with mercantile groups and thieves guild.

In the {{YearlinkName|1368}}, foreign agents of [[Thay]] formed their [[Thayan enclave|enclave]] in the city of Proskur.

The city was annexed by the increasingly-powerful Cormyr in the {{YearlinkName|1405}} however, as the Kingdom of the Purple Dragon expanded its hold over much of the lands south of the [[Dragonmere]]. In the years that followed Proskur underwent a change to become a respectable place of just laws and honest trade,

Notable Locations.Inns & Taverns: * [[Standing Stone Inn]], a successfully-run inn that was renovated and later bought out by the Thayans of the enclave.
Notable Locations.Shops & Businesses:
* House of the Sword, an armorer's shop run by the [[Harper]] agent [[Helmir Obersaer]].<ref name=CotH-p71">
* [[Thayan enclave (Proskur)|Thayan enclave]], a Red Wizard [[Thayan enclave|enclave]] of about 150 people that legally dealt in drugs and slaves as well as the more-standard fare.
Notable Locations.Temples:
* [[Rogue Redeemed]], the local temple to [[Mask]] led by Patriarch [[Milo Hallyspear]].
* Temple of Tempus, a holy house of the [[Lord of Battles]] overseen by Priest-Captain [[Dologar Nathan]] and his six lesser clergy.

document_data.Rumors & Legends: During the mid–14{{th}} century DR, there were rumors that [[Zhentarim]] agents were operating within the city.
